channel.title: Walking...?
channel.description:
iv just started my first script, and i was going to start on the walking routes from draynor bank to the trees near port sarim.
Only problem is im not quite sure how to go about it :( :confused:
Do i always get it to move my sprite by clicking in the mini map or would it be detectable if i always do this??? Also i was going to use DTMs to recognise places on the mini map im guessing the co-ords it returns are of the first point on my DTM am i right???
PS do i need to make the screen revolve??? and am i right to use DTMs
Thankful for any and all help
Pupp3tMast3r

item.title: Walking...?
item.dc:creator: @Boreas Boreas
item.description:
@Boreas wrote:

Although it seems you’re not using dtms anymore people may find this useful anyway. Dtms work with the first dot, aka the parent dot. You guessed correctly.

Read full topic

item.title: Walking...?
item.dc:creator: @pupp3tmast3r pupp3tmast3r
item.description:
@pupp3tmast3r wrote:

thanx pyro that was verry helpful and that way your speaking of is undetectable(to an extent)?? im gunna mkae multiple walking paths and have things like random antibans and mouselifts would that make it “bust prof”

thanx again, ill try your procedures in my script tomorow

Read full topic

item.title: Walking...?
item.dc:creator: @Pyro Pyro
item.description:
@Pyro wrote:

Ok dont listen to nix. He really doesnt know what you want. If your using dtms to walk it will turn out to be a hefty process. Since the screen rotates you will either need to load dtms of diff angles or finddtmrotated. Both of which will lag your script. If your using srl you could try your hand at radial walk. Although it may take some time getting used to. If you have a look in srl at stupid3ooo’s old walking procedures. There the ones i used to use when i was first creating scripts. Basically you input the direction you want to go and the roadcolor and it will click as far in the direction as the road will take it (kinda) and yes use minimap to walk

Read full topic
